actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1596.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1596 — "To rename the Anahuac National Wildlife Refuge located in the State of Texas as the "Jocelyn Nungaray National Wildlife Refuge"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1044.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1044 — "To amend Public Law 99-338 with respect to Kaweah Project permits."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1729.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1729 — "To amend the John D. Dingell, Jr. Conservation, Management, and Recreation Act to allow for additional entities to be eligible to complete the maintenance work on Bolts Ditch and the Bolts Ditch Headgate within the Holy Cross Wilderness, Colorado."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2316.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2316 — "To amend the Pittman-Robertson Wildlife Restoration Act to provide that interest on obligations held in the Federal aid to wildlife restoration fund shall become available for apportionment at the beginning of fiscal year 2033."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 900.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 900 — "To direct the Director of the United States Geological Survey to establish a program to map zones that are at greater risk of sinkhole formation, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3657.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3657 — "To amend the Federal Power Act to require the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to annually submit to Congress a report on the status of ongoing hydropower relicensing applications."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1765.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1765 — "To direct the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information to take certain actions to enhance the representation of the United States and promote United States leadership in communications standards-setting bodies, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1717.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1717 — "To direct the Federal Communications Commission to establish a council to make recommendations on ways to increase the security, reliability, and interoperability of communications networks, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2037.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2037 — "To provide outreach and technical assistance to small providers regarding Open RAN networks, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1455.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1455 — "To codify the Institute for Telecommunication Sciences and to direct the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information to establish an initiative to support the development of emergency communication and tracking technologies, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House resumed debate on H.R. 1766.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed H.R. 517.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1766.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1766 — "To amend the National Telecommunications and Information Administration Organization Act to establish the Office of Policy Development and Cybersecurity, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1770.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1770 — "To direct the Consumer Product Safety Commission to establish a pilot program to explore the use of artificial intelligence in support of the mission of the Commission and to direct the Secretary of Commerce and the Federal Trade Commission to study and report on the use of blockchain technology and tokens, respectively."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1618.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1618 — "To require the Federal Communications Commission to review certain rules of the Commission and develop recommendations for rule changes to promote precision agriculture, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1709.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1709 — "To direct the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information to submit to Congress a report examining the cybersecurity of mobile service networks, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 14.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 14.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Young Kim to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
